questions.question: On the opening night of the 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, who won the women's 10,000m?
questions.explanation: Beatrice Chebet of Kenya won the women's 10,000m on opening night in Tokyo. Nadia Battocletti finished second (silver) and Gudaf Tsegay took bronze; Lilian Kasait Rengeruk did not place on the podium. (Gout Gout is an Australian sprinter and did not win this event.)

questions.question: During the nationwide rival rallies on 13 September 2025, which capital city saw about 3,000 people attend the 'Australia Unites Against Government Corruption' rally?
questions.explanation: ABC News reported that Sydney's 'Australia Unites Against Government Corruption' rally drew about 3,000 people. Other capitals had smaller crowd estimates (e.g. ~2,500 in Melbourne, ~1,000–1,500 in Brisbane, and hundreds in Adelaide).

questions.question: Following the death of Luke Briggs after his arrest in Hoppers Crossing, which criminal charge was laid against two Victoria Police officers in the recent announcement?
questions.explanation: Homicide Squad detectives announced that the two officers were charged with negligent manslaughter over Luke Briggs's death after his July 2024 arrest; they were granted bail and are due back in court. (ABC News report, 11–12 Sep 2025.)

questions.question: According to ABC News' live blog of the 13 September 2025 Rugby Championship match in Sydney (Argentina 28–26 Australia), how many penalties did ABC report Australia conceded during the match?
questions.explanation: ABC's live-updates blog explicitly states the Wallabies gave away a 14th penalty in the match — the live blog records 'a 14th that went against the Wallabies in the match.'

questions.question: Which arts leader is presiding over her final Brisbane Festival program in 2025, described as a 'swan‑song' as she leaves to take up the chief executive / artistic director role at Brisbane Powerhouse?
questions.explanation: Louise Bezzina is the outgoing artistic director whose 2025 Brisbane Festival program has been framed as her swan‑song; she is leaving to take up the chief executive / artistic director role at Brisbane Powerhouse.
